structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Bond of county surveyor -- Minimum -- Record.
law.text: The county surveyor, before he enters on the duties of his office, shall give a bond in the minimum amount of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) with sureties approved by the fiscal court, which shall record the approval in its minutes and shall file the bond with the county clerk.
law.history: Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 86, sec. 6, effective July 15, 1996. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 384, sec. 173, effective June 17, 1978. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4672.
